intro: Potentilla wrangeliana, commonly known as Wrangel's cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Eurasia. It typically reaches a height of 10–20 centimeters and features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with five leaflets, which are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Potentilla wrangeliana is often found in tundra and alpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
